title: Unholy alliance? BJP, Cong units tie up for Maha civic body polls; face fire from leadership
content: In Ambernath, the Congress suspended its corporators and block president for aligning with the BJP-led Ambernath Vikas Aghadi to form the civic administration, sidelining the Shiv Sena. This rare local alliance between rivals occurred despite the Shiv Sena emerging as the single largest party in the municipal elections.

title: ‘Glad to speak with my friend’: PM Modi holds talks with Israeli PM Netanyahu
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, conveying New Year greetings and discussing ways to strengthen the India-Israel strategic partnership. The leaders also exchanged views on the regional situation and reaffirmed their shared resolve to fight terrorism with greater determination.

title: Sooryavanshi carnage bamboozles South Africa U19s with 63-ball ton
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi continued his exceptional form, scoring a rapid 127 off 74 balls in the third U-19 ODI against South Africa. This century, following a blistering 68 in the previous match, highlights his dominance as he leads the Indian side. His explosive batting reinforces his reputation as a top young talent.

title: Elon Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy suggestions, including massive battery, EV, and solar production. He emphasized batteries as key to increasing energy output, citing Tesla's Megapacks and the new Megablock as solutions for grid stability and AI-driven power demands.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in major cities - check rates
content: Gold prices experienced a slight dip on Wednesday as investors engaged in profit-booking following recent strong gains. The focus has now shifted to upcoming US economic data. Both domestic and international gold futures saw declines, with silver also trading lower after touching near-record highs.

title: ‘Military is always an option’: Purchase or invade? Trump weighs how US could acquire Greenland
content: President Trump is actively discussing options to acquire Greenland, including potential military use, viewing it as a national security priority. While the administration explores purchase or association agreements, Greenland and Denmark firmly oppose any such move, emphasizing Danish sovereignty and the island's right to self-determination.

title: Apple execs won't leave South Korea: Hunting Samsung, SK Hynix supply; iPhone RAM at risk
content: Tech giants, including Apple, are reportedly camping out in South Korean hotels to secure crucial memory chip supplies.  A global shortage, driven by AI demand, has sent RAM prices soaring, forcing companies to negotiate long-term contracts.  This situation could lead to higher iPhone prices or reduced memory in future models.

title: Arjun Tendulkar and Saaniya Chandhok set to marry — date finalised?
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of legendary cricketer Sachin Tendulkar, is set to marry Saaniya Chandok in March. The couple, who got engaged last August, come from prominent families. Saaniya is involved in entrepreneurship and hails from a business family with interests in food and hospitality. Arjun is building his own cricket career as a bowling allrounder.

title: The 25:1 problem: What India loses when students leave and don’t return
content: India’s brain drain is not just about students leaving—it is about a system that sends talent out at scale while struggling to attract it in. As outbound mobility surges and inbound remains thin, internationalisation turns one-way. The fix is not guilt or rhetoric, but making Indian campuses reliable, competitive spaces where staying—or coming—feels like a smart, credible choice.

title: Quote of the day: Gates on lesson from Buffett; ‘You don’t have to fill every second to succeed’
content: Bill Gates revealed a key lesson learned from Warren Buffett: success doesn't require a packed schedule. Buffett's intentionally light calendar taught Gates that controlling one's time, rather than filling every minute, is crucial. Gates, who previously believed in constant work, now advises others not to wait as long to embrace this realization.

title: Jacob Bethell matches Kapil Dev's rare record at SCG
content: Jacob Bethell achieved a significant milestone by scoring his maiden first-class century against Australia in the Ashes Test. The 22-year-old's composed knock at the Sydney Cricket Ground places him in elite company, joining legendary England batters and a rare group of cricketers with maiden centuries in both first-class and List-A international matches.

title: T20 WC: Bangladesh rejects ultimatum claims; BCB says ICC assures team's participation
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has received a formal response from the ICC regarding security concerns for the T20 World Cup 2026 in India. The ICC reiterated its commitment to Bangladesh's participation and assured that their inputs on security planning will be considered. The BCB has denied any ultimatum was issued, calling such reports false and unfounded.

title: Delhi demolition drive: SP MP Mohibbullah Nadvi present at site; 5 arrested
content: Delhi police have arrested five individuals following stone-pelting during a court-ordered demolition near Faiz-e-Elahi Masjid. The Municipal Corporation of Delhi cleared encroached land, including commercial establishments, leading to the incident where five police personnel were injured. Authorities assure the mosque remains safe and warn against violence and provocation.

title: From $13mn to $8.4b: San Francisco 49ers owner York family net worth
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: MLB trade rumors: Blue Jays eye $500mn Chicago Cubs superstar signing
content: A potential trade between the Toronto Blue Jays and Houston Astros could see Kyle Tucker move to Toronto. This deal would significantly impact both teams, with Toronto acquiring a star outfielder and Houston focusing on cost control and future depth. The trade involves a steep prospect cost for Toronto and potential payroll flexibility for Houston.

title: Travis Kelce at breaking point as Taylor Swift reaches new career high
content: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: Jana Nayagan cleared in UK; Thalapathy Vijay starrer gets BBFC 15, India CBFC pending
content: Jana Nayagan secured UK censor approval with a 15 rating, citing strong language and violence. Meanwhile, India's censor board delay continues, prompting producers to approach the Madras High Court. The film's release remains uncertain amid reports of potential issues in Saudi Arabia as well.

title: Why you are seeing names flashing for calls from unknown numbers?
content: India's telecom sector is rolling out Calling Name Presentation (CNAP), a new feature displaying registered caller names on incoming calls. This initiative, driven by DOT and TRAI, aims to combat rising spam and fraud by enhancing caller identification. The nationwide rollout for 4G and 5G networks is expected by March 31, 2026.

title: IPL: 'What is the fault of that poor player?' - J&K CM questions Mustafizur Rahman's exit
content: Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah questioned the IPL's decision to release Bangladeshi cricketer Mustafizur Rahman, citing strained India-Bangladesh ties. He argued that removing a single player wouldn't resolve diplomatic issues and could negatively impact the upcoming T20 World Cup, with Bangladesh potentially boycotting India as host.

title: UAE offers ‘citizenship’ to businesses under New Corporate Law 2026
content: UAE companies now officially hold 'citizenship' status, recognizing them as Emirati entities under a new Commercial Companies Law. This move, applicable to mainland and free-zone businesses, enhances global credibility and trade access. It clarifies that this status applies solely to the legal entity, not individual owners, bolstering the UAE's appeal for international business growth and investment.

title: BJP worker 'stripped' by police during SIR drive in Hubbali; cops deny allegations
content: A BJP worker claims police assaulted her during a voter list revision in Hubballi. The incident followed a complaint by Congress corporator Suvarna Kallakuntla. Police state the worker resisted arrest and stripped herself. Counter-complaints have been filed by both sides. Senior police officials are reviewing the situation.

title: Indian presenter breaks silence on her Bangladesh Premier League exit
content: Indian presenter Ridhima Pathak clarified she voluntarily withdrew from the Bangladesh Premier League due to the political climate, refuting reports of being dropped. This comes amid heightened India-Bangladesh tensions, including a ban on IPL broadcasts in Bangladesh following a player dispute. The situation has led to significant BPL panel changes.

title: The Mutual Fund Advisor: FD vs Mutual Funds - you are asking the wrong question!
content: If you use equity funds mainly for long-term goals of 10 years or more, combine them with the right amount of debt for stability, and behave sensibly during bad years, then yes—historically they have outpaced FDs by a wide margin more often than not.

title: 19 years, two daughters, zero drama: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban’s unexpected divorce story
content: Hollywood star Nicole Kidman and country singer Keith Urban have officially ended their 19-year marriage. The divorce was finalised in Nashville court on January 6, 2026. Both stars have agreed to an amicable split, with their daughters Sunday Rose and Faith Margaret remaining their top priority. They will share joint decision-making for their children.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection day 34: Ranveer, Akshaye film slows down; crossed Rs 780 cr
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive run, now crossing Rs 782 crore nett in India and Rs 1,247 crore gross worldwide. Despite a natural slowdown after a record-breaking month, the Ranveer Singh starrer has become the highest-grossing Hindi film ever. The movie faced competition but maintained its stronghold, with recent days showing expected dips as the holiday rush concludes.

title: Phoenix Spicer’s family speak out after cruel rumour following his death at 23
content: Phoenix Spicer’s family has denied online claims that the former North Melbourne player died by suicide. Phoenix Spicer passed away on January 2, 2026, aged 23. His partner’s sister, Dharna Nicholson-Bux, asked people to stop spreading false rumours. Tributes have poured in from fans and North Melbourne.

title: Gurgaon: Woman takes hours-long ride, threatens driver with false molestation case when asked to pay; booked
content: A woman in Gurgaon refused to pay her cab fare after an extensive ride, even threatening the driver with false police accusations. The driver filed a complaint, leading police to identify her as a repeat offender who had previously defrauded a salon and another cab driver. An FIR has been registered, and an arrest is imminent.

title: 'Called out of factory, shot 7 times': Hindu man gunned down in Bangladesh
content: A Hindu leader and journalist in Bangladesh's Jessore district was shot dead by radical Islamists after regularly paying protection money. Rana Pratap Bairagi, affiliated with the Awami League, was targeted despite paying 3 lakh taka recently. His murder highlights the fear and extortion faced by minorities in the region.

title: Magic Johnson shares rare personal update with longtime rival Larry Bird
content: Magic Johnson shared a rare personal update after joining longtime rival Larry Bird at a public event in Phoenix. The two NBA legends spoke before a crowd of 4,000, revisiting the rivalry that shaped the league during the 1980s. Their appearance highlighted how the Magic-Bird competition continues to resonate decades after redefining basketball’s popularity and culture.

title: Kohli fans think his Rs 65,000 cardigan is sweet nod to wife Anushka as he arrives for NZ ODI
content: Virat Kohli made waves as he arrived in Mumbai for the New Zealand series, sporting a  cardigan embellished with a striking red 'A' and heart. Fans quickly speculated that this was a sweet nod to his wife, Anushka Sharma, igniting a flurry of affectionate posts across social media.

title: Delhi: MCD's demolition drive near mosque turns violent; 5 cops injured in stone pelting
content: Acting on Delhi High Court orders, the Municipal Corporation of Delhi conducted an early-morning demolition drive near Faiz-e-Elahi Masjid. Despite heavy police security and coordination efforts, a brief stone-pelting incident occurred, which was controlled with minimal force. The operation to clear encroached land proceeded with around 17 bulldozers.

title: Why NMC shut down the MBBS course at Vaishno Devi medical college in J&K
content: The National Medical Commission withdrew approval for the MBBS course at Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence after a surprise inspection found serious deficiencies in faculty, infrastructure and clinical exposure. Despite political protests over student composition, the shutdown was based on regulatory non-compliance. Existing students will be relocated to other medical colleges as supernumerary seats.

title: Mohanlal exits Chiranjeevi film: Rs 30 cr demand alters Bobby's plans - report
content: A major budget issue has reportedly stalled Chiranjeevi's film directed by Bobby, after Mohanlal's unexpected Rs 30 crore demand for a cameo. The makers, who hoped for a free appearance as a goodwill gesture, are now seeking a Telugu star for the role without payment.

title: Office productivity just performance? ‘I sit for 8 hrs & pretend to work,’ shares employee
content: A Reddit post by a young intern highlights a growing workplace trend called “task masking,” appearing busy without doing meaningful work. From interns to senior leaders, many admit to performing productivity rather than producing results. In reality, task masking is a management and culture problem, driven by visibility-based evaluation, unclear goals, and fear of being seen as idle.

title: 'You will rise...': Mahua Moitra pens poem for Umar Khalid; here's what she wrote
content: Trinamool MP Mahua Moitra shared a poem supporting jailed activist Umar Khalid after the Supreme Court denied him bail in a 2020 Delhi riots case. While Khalid and Sharjeel Imam were denied bail, others received it. JNU students reportedly raised anti-Modi slogans, drawing sharp criticism from BJP leaders who labelled them 'anti-India urban naxals' and condemned the slogans as 'treason'.

title: Deepika's strict upbringing sparks debate on modern parenting
content: Deepika Padukone shared her father's strict discipline methods.  This experience prompts a discussion on effective parenting.  Isolation tactics create fear, not understanding.  Constructive discipline focuses on teaching and positive reinforcement.  Setting clear rules and allowing choices builds confidence.  Disrupting generational patterns requires self-reflection.  Padukone's openness encourages evolving family legacies.

title: Gold price prediction today: Where are gold, silver prices headed?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold and silver prices may see volatility with some consolidative bias in the coming days, says Maneesh Sharma, AVP - Commodities & Currencies, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers. He shares his outlook for gold and silver prices in the coming days:

title: Egg-cellent tips: Chefs' secret to perfect boiled eggs
content: Boiling an egg is not easy, but it is one of the most daunting tasks if you don't know the basics and trust us, the basics are quite hard to master. From your choice of the yolk to the time to the temperature of the water to the age of the egg, everything together contributes to the final texture of a boiled egg.

title: After 10 daughters, Haryana couple welcome a son; father denies patriarchy claims
content: A Haryana woman has given birth to her eleventh child, a son, after ten daughters. The high-risk delivery was successful, with both mother and child recovering well. The father expressed happiness and denied patriarchal attitudes, emphasizing his daughters' capabilities despite societal preferences for male children.

title: T.N. Forest dept. denies permission for further exploratory tests at Upper Bhavani hydroelectric project site
content: Conservationists who spoke to The Hindu said that the project would heap a tremendous amount of pressure onto the ecologically fragile area, home to a number of key species of flora and fauna

title: Understand the difference: Rahul Gandhi takes dig at government over Trump’s remarks
content: Earlier, Mr. Trump said that Prime Minister Modi is “not that happy with me” because of the tariffs imposed by Washington on Delhi for its purchases of Russian oil

title: Jamaat-e-Islami Hind says will vote for ‘winnable’ LDF, UDF candidates in Kerala Assembly polls to keep BJP at bay
content: Admitting that the same stance was taken in recent local body polls, Jamaat-e-Islami Hind Kerala amir P. Mujeeb Rahman says the ‘main agenda’ of the organisation is to keep BJP away from power in Kerala

title: Andhra Minister Narayana launches Land Pooling Scheme-II in Amaravati
content: Minister Narayana announced ₹1.50 lakh debt waiver for families who gave their lands for construction of the Capital Amaravati

title: Ballari range DIG transferred after clash that killed Congress party worker in Karnataka
content: In another key posting, Sumana D. Pennekar, who was serving as Deputy Commissioner of Police (Intelligence), Bengaluru, has been appointed as Superintendent of Police, Ballari district

title: PM Modi speaks with Netanyahu, discusses ways to strengthen India-Israel strategic partnership
content: The two leaders resolved to fight terrorism with greater determination, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on social media

title: Mauritius President visits Tirumala temple
content: Mauritius President Dharambeer Gokhool was accorded a traditional reception by Endowments Minister Anam Ramnarayan Reddy, TTD Chairman B.R. Naidu, and Executive Officer Anil Kumar Singhal

title: NHAI’s world records in Andhra Pradesh are a proud moment: CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: The CM conveyed best wishes to the team as two more Guinness World Records are being attempted in the second and third packages of NH-544G

title: Claim of residing at now-demolished houses at Kogilu for 28 years ‘factually incorrect’, State Government tells Karnataka High Court
content: Authorities have satellite images to show when houses were constructed, Advocate General tells the court during hearing of PIL petition filed by three women, who were among those whose houses were demolished

title: Watch: Ahead of Pongal, jaggery production in full swing in Vellore
content: Behind the scenes at a village in Vellore district, Tamil Nadu, that is engaged in jaggery production for two generations. These farmers produce about 200 kg of jaggery per day.

title: IUML leader V.K. Ebrahim Kunju laid to rest with State honours
content: The body was kept at his residence in Aluva for public homage till 9 a.m in the morning. Several persons paid last respects to the departed leader at his residence and later at Alangad Juma Masjid

title: Supeme Court asks govt to forward entire audio clip allegedly on former Manipur CM Biren Singh
content: The court told the government to forward it to the NFSU for expedite action and submission of report in a sealed cover

title: Probe ordered into alleged medical negligence in Wayanad hospital after woman finds cotton cloth left inside post-cesarean
content: Decision to carry out investigation taken after 21-year-old woman submitted a complaint to Minister O.R. Kelu alleging lapses in her treatment

title: Dindigul after dark
content: At Ponram, Dindigul Nights brings together memories,family recipes, and regional favourites just the way they’ve been cooked and eaten for generations to recreatethe flavours of late evenings in Dindigul .

title: DGGI arrests Orange Transport MD, another businessman in ₹50-crore GST evasion cases
content: Sunil Kumar and N. Chethan have been accused of GST evasion and orchestrating fake ITC racket respectively

title: NGO rescues 14 illegally relocated puppies in Chikkaballapur
content: Officials of the Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) said they have not received any complaint of illegal relocation

title: Truck driver’s death in alleged illegal quarry: Karnataka Upa Lokayukta books AC, tahsildar, DySP, seven others for dereliction of duty
content: The action follows an online news report about a truck loaded with construction stones plunging into a gorge at a stone-crushing unit in Mandya district in Karnataka

title: Delhi Assembly Winter session: Ruckus continues as BJP protests Atishi’s remarks
content: BJP protests Ms. Atishi’s remarks allegedly insulting Guru Tegh Bahadur; Speaker Vijender Gupta says unfortunate that no communication has been made regarding the matter

title: BJP, Congress team up to keep Sena out of local body, Fadnavis vows action for ‘indiscipline’
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis orders cancellation of alliances formed to run Ambarnath Municipal Council, Congress serves notices to its councillors

title: All-India Tiger Estimation begins at Thanthai Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary in Erode
content: Though the estimation primarily focuses on tiger reserves, forest divisions with the presence of co-predators and other carnivores are also being covered

title: Form district-level panels to end ‘orderly’ system in Police dept.: Madras HC to T.N. Home Secretary
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and C. Kumarappan order that the committees must be constituted within two weeks

title: Cold conditions persist in parts of India
content: While Kashmir records sub-zero night temperatures, it dropped to under 5 degrees Celsius in parts of Haryana and Punjab

title: Police probe on after infant taken beneath captive elephant in Haripad
content: Visuals show the child slipping from the mahout’s hands and falling near the jumbo’s feet during the ritual; the child, however, escaped without injuries

title: Twenty six Maoists surrender in Sukma
content: The cadres, including seven women, turned themselves in before senior police and CRPF officials in Sukma under the “Poona Margem” (from rehabilitation to social reintegration) rehabilitation initiative, police said

title: Badlapur sexual assault case whistleblower joins NCP
content: Ms. Chendvankar later contested the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly polls from Murbad constituency in Thane district on the MNS ticket but faced defeat

title: Watch: Pop-up bike library in Thoothukudi is getting people to read more
content: A bike library, run by a 34-year-old data entry operator Kumizhmunai J Simon Aravinth Singh, from Thoothukudi for the past two years, driven by a genuine cause to cultivate the reading habit among youngsters and to spotlight the books written by new and emerging writers.

title: V.D. Satheesan says CPI(M) leader A.K. Balan’s Jamaat-e-Islami  remarks ‘echo Hindu majoritarian narrative’
content: Kerala Opposition Leader says CPI(M) is ‘increasingly speaking in the same bigoted voice of Sangh Parivar’

title: T.N. Transport department to operate over 22,700 buses from Chennai for Pongal
content: Transport Minister S.S. Sivasankar, at a press meet held at the Secretariat on Tuesday (January 6, 2026), said the operation of special buses will begin from January 9 and go on till January 14

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: Former TDB president A. Padmakumar denied bail again
content: Vigilance court notes that given Padmakumar’s “substantial political influence” and former administrative status, his release at this sensitive stage could lead to destruction or manipulation of vital electronic and documentary evidence

title: Delhi Court orders removal of posts linking BJP leader to Ankita Bhandari murder case
content: The High Court also passed the interim order against other persons and entities, including Urmila Sanawar and Uttarakhand Pradesh Congress Committee, in a defamation suit filed by Dushyant Kumar Gautam

title: Police accused of disrobing woman during arrest in Hubballi, action sought after video goes viral
content: The alleged incident took place when police went to arrest the woman based on complaints of local residents in connection with a clash that reportedly took place during the mapping for SIR on January 1

title: Musicians pay homage to saint-composer Thyagaraja at Thiruvaiyaru
content: At the conclusion of the rendering of the pancharatna kritis, a maha arathi was performed at the Thyagarajaswamy Athishtanam

title: Commissioning of Samudra Pratap strengthens self-reliance: PM Modi
content: PM Modi said Samudra Pratap adds strength to our vision of self-reliance and boosts our security apparatus

title: Six-year-old girl found murdered at Whitefield in Bengaluru
content: According to the police, her father saw the child playing in front of the family’s makeshift house when he briefly returned home for lunch

title: Thirupparankundram row: Madras High Court to hear case against personal attacks on Justice G.R. Swaminathan
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan agreed to hear on Wednesday afternoon a case against the portrayal of the judge as an RSS sympathiser

title: Don’t force BJP to open ‘pages from past’: Maharashtra Minister Bawankule to Ajit Pawar
content: Mr. Bawankule reminded Mr. Pawar of the mutual decision taken in the coordination committee of Mahayuti before the civic polls that even if alliance partners contest the polls separately, they will not criticise each other during campaigning

title: CM Mamata Banerjee remembers those killed in West Bengal's Netai village 15 years ago
content: In a post on X, CM Mamata Banerjee expressed her “humble respects and salutations” to those who lost their lives in the incident of firing

title: T.N. State Planning Commission study flags seed availability, timing as hurdles to green manuring uptake
content: A majority of farmers said that they have benefited out of the scheme, and around 98% of farmers who were surveyed expressed willingness to recommend green manuring to their peers

title: Anbumani-led PMK joins AIADMK-BJP alliance ahead of T.N. Assembly election
content: Since the revival of the AIADMK-BJP ties in April 2025, the PMK is the first party of considerable following to join the coalition

title: Jadavpur University develops Braille card game to centre disability in literature
content: A card game, centering disabled authors and designed with tactile cues, aims to reimagine how Braille, literature, and pedagogy can intersect in contemporary classrooms

title: Andhra Pradesh: Private bus gutted due to short circuit, none hurt in Rajamahendravaram
content: The driver alerted the passengers about the short circuit before parking the bus on the Gammon bridge

title: CPI(M) MLA V.K. Prasanth to vacate Sasthamangalam office amid row involving BJP councillor Sreelekha
content: Prasanth says he ‘does not want the controversy to drag on’. Vattiyurkavu MLA to shift his office to Maruthankuzhy

title: Protest in Harihar against closure of schools run by government of Karnataka
content: AIDSO State Vice-President Apoorva C.M. said that both the Congress and the BJP were jointly responsible for the sorry state of government schools in Karnataka

title: 'Gangster' accused in murder case of Punjab sarpanch in Amritsar killed in police encounter
content: The encounter took place in the Bhikhiwind police station area, when teams from the Tarn Taran police and Anti-Gangster Task Force (AGTF) initiated a manhunt

title: How the Tamil Nadu legislature, in the late 1940s, viewed the making of the Constitution
content: In the Constituent Assembly’s debates (1946-49), K. Santhanam and N.G. Ranga, both from southern States representing the present Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh, had strongly argued against any attempt to make the Central government more powerful under the garb of expanding the Concurrent List

title: Man held for death of couple in Tiruvannamalai
content: Based on an alert from residents, Chengam police inspected the spot and sent the bodies to Government Medical College Hospital in Tiruvannamalai town for postmortem

title: When eggs, stones were hurled at T.N. Governor Channa Reddy’s convoy and CM Jayalalithaa sought his recall
content: The incident occurred in 1995 when hostilities between Jayalalithaa and Reddy were common knowledge. While the Governor sent a report to the Centre against the AIADMK government, the Chief Minister wrote to President Shankar Dayal Sharma and Prime Minister P.V. Narasimha Rao.

title: Five days after Ballari SP suspended, no replacement yet
content: The Superintendent of Police of the neighbouring Chitradurga district is holding additional charge of the district since then

title: BJP local leaders resolve to go it alone in local bodies polls in Mandya
content: BJP leader and former Minister Narayana Gowda expressed concern that the JD(S) had decided to go it alone thought the BJP had campaigned hard for Mr. Kumaraswamy during the Lok Sabha polls

title: Bihar’s Rajgir hills welcomes migratory birds from Europe, Central Asia
content: Environment, Forest and Climate Forest Department’s December 2025 survey found 135 species of birds including 33 migratory birds in Rajgir hills

title: Schools up to Class 8 in Noida shut till January 10 due to cold wave
content: The order applies to all recognised schools affiliated with the CBSE, ICSE, IB, the Uttar Pradesh Board and other boards operating in the district

title: In an age of nationalism, a month-long art exhibition in Kolkata on the idea of land
content: Land carries deep cultural and emotional significance, anchoring identity, heritage and community ties, curator Ina Puri says

title: Economist Amartya Sen not required to attend SIR hearing over spelling error, says ECI
content: The Commission emphasised that minor errors in voters' names do not affect the hearing process or a voter's rights, and authorities have been warned to avoid creating public disputes over such technicalities

title: BJP planning to manipulate electoral rolls, ‘delete names of 10,000 voters’: Assam MLA
content: Akhil Gogoi says  MLAs and district presidents were given a January 12 deadline to submit booth-wise lists of voters who do not vote for the BJP, so that their names could be deleted

title: Doctors’ stir: Odisha govt. invokes ESMA
content: Over 6000 doctors in 32 district headquarter hospitals, 300 community health centres and other primary health centres are participating in the strike

title: Luxembourg 'very important' partner for India: Jaishankar
content: New Delhi and Luxembourg can collaborate much more on many interesting issues, including fintech, space, the digital world, and AI, the External Affairs Minister said

title: NMC withdraws Mata Vaishno Devi varsity’s MBBS list with 42 Muslim candidates citing 'non-compliance'; BJP welcomes move
content: Officials said the NMC’s Medical Assessment and Rating Board withdrew the Letter of Permission granted to the varsity in Reasi for running the MBBS course with 50 seats for 2025-26

title: Grok obscene AI content: govt. gives X time till January 7 to submit report
content: The government had issued a stern warning to the Elon Musk-led social media platform over indecent and sexually-explicit content being generated through misuse of AI-based services like 'Grok' and other tools

title: Kalamassery municipality seeks easing of curbs on construction works
content: Restrictions under green zone regulation will impact setting up of buildings on land proposed for judicial city, says municipal chairperson

title: Shoddy waste management should be blamed on lack of proper mechanism: experts
content: The panellists listed the gaps in strategy, policy, and implementation of schemes, while acknowledging some of the positive models that have made an impact, like the Indore project and the decentralised model in Noida

title: No offline quota of SriVani darshan tickets at Tirumala from January 9
content: 800 tickets, issued daily through offline counters, will be migrated to online platform; offline current booking of 200 tickets at Tirupati airport, however, to continue

title: Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan’s remarks on ‘PM kidnap’ sparks a row
content: Referring to capture of Venezuela’s Maduro, the former Union Minister later said he was not predicting anything, but was issuing a warning that countries need to stand together to maintain global order

title: MLC Kavitha’s resignation accepted by Telangana Legislative Council Chairman
content: Legislature Secretariat issues notification and notifies vacancy for Nizamabad Local Authorities Constituency.

title: ED uncovers ‘suspected misuse’ of foreign funds to influence India’s energy policy
content: On January 5, the agency searched various premises linked to SSPL in the national capital region as part of an ongoing investigation into suspicious foreign inward remittances

title: APSRTC prioritises intra-State services for Sankranti travel
content: 8,432 special buses planned as Stree Shakthi scheme drives higher passenger movement to district towns and villages

title: BJP-led Centre undermining Haryana, says Hooda
content: Hooda demanded that Haryana be designated as the host or co-host state for the 2030 Commonwealth Games and the proposed 2036 Olympics

title: Ready for further probe in Ankita Bhandari murder case: Uttarakhand CM Dhami
content: Dhami said the case has affected Uttarakhand residents who, he added, have “expressed their views with sensitivity”

title: India probe finds Tata Steel, JSW Steel, SAIL breached antitrust law, regulatory order shows: report
content: The CCI has asked the steel companies to submit their audited financial statements for the eight financial years to 2023, the October order showed.

title: Prevention key to tackling human trafficking, says official
content: Suryakumari stresses early intervention, coordinated implementation of schemes and community awareness at regional Training of Trainers programme in Vijayawada

title: Harbaugh out as Ravens coach after playoff miss
content: The Ravens fired John Harbaugh, less than 48 hours after losing to the Steelers and failing to reach the playoffs. Sources told ESPN that he's expected to emerge as a favorite for the Giants job but will be in demand for many other teams as well.

title: QB Williams hits portal despite signed UW deal
content: Washington quarterback Demond Williams Jr. said on social media Tuesday night he is entering the transfer portal, a move that comes just days after he agreed to return to the Huskies for the 2026 season.

title: Chambliss pleads case, hopeful NCAA OKs waiver
content: Trinidad Chambliss acknowledged being a "little frustrated" as he awaits an NCAA decision on a potential waiver for the 2026 season, while his lawyer, Tom Mars, told ESPN that they're working on immediate contingency plans in the event it's denied.

title: Longhorns great Shipley severely burned on ranch
content: Former Texas Longhorns star Jordan Shipley is in critical but stable condition after suffering "severe" burns in an accident on his ranch in Texas on Tuesday, his family said.

title: Top prospect Peterson forces OT in wild KU rally
content: Kansas freshman Darryn Peterson scored a career-high 32 points, including three free throws to tie the score at the end of regulation, in a 104-100 comeback win over TCU.

title: LeBron says it's on him to bend game around Luka
content: Amid his recent scoring surge, Lakers star LeBron James reiterated Tuesday night that teammate Luka Doncic doesn't "need to bend his game [for me]," adding, "It's up to us to bend our game around him."

title: Declining Devils author 'embarrassing' 9-0 loss
content: The New Jersey Devils, struggling for nearly two months after a scorching 8-1 start, are now searching for answers after a 9-0 loss to the New York Islanders Tuesday, one in which goaltender Jacob Markstrom gave up goals on the first two shots he faced.

title: LSU's Weis with Rebels; has done 'terrific job'
content: Ole Miss offensive assistant Joe Judge praised offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. for how he has been able to juggle his responsibilities with the Rebels and LSU.

title: 🔮 Myth-busters for the 14 NFL playoff teams
content: The Packers need a WR1? The Broncos can't keep winning tight games? The Pats' run defense and the Seahawks' run offense are problems? We're not so sure.

content: García's star turn is the latest sign that Spain might have a genuine goalkeeping battle on their hands.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City still keen on Guéhi move
content: Manchester City are looking to reinforce at center back, with Crystal Palace's Marc Guéhi being of interest. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Amsterdam Airport Cancels 700 Flights Due To Severe Snow, Wind Disruptions
content: Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, one of the largest in Europe, announced at least 700 flight cancellations Wednesday because of snow and wind, following days of weather-related travel disruptions.

title: Mosque, Graveyard And A Court Order: Behind Delhi Demolition Clash
content: A violent clash erupted early this morning during an anti-encroachment drive near a mosque in Delhi. Locals threw stones at municipal officials and police teams during the demolition on a land adjoining the Syed Faiz Elahi mosque at Ramlila Maidan.

title: In Maharashtra Town, BJP-Congress Unite To Keep Sena Out, Then Suspensions
content: The political developments in the Ambernath Municipal Council of Thane district have triggered a major churn not only in the local politics but also across Maharashtra.

title: Telangana Students Protest Over Government Notice To Hyderabad University
content: A notice issued by the Congress-led Telangana government to reclaim 50 acres of land at the Maulana Azad National Urdu University (MANUU) has triggered strong student protests and a political storm in the state.

title: During Op Sindoor, A Worried Pakistan Ran To US For Help, Shows Document
content: Pakistan ran to the US for help during Indian airstrikes on their airbases and terror camps, US government filings have revealed, exposing Pakistani lies and misinformation campaign during Operation Sindoor.

title: Opinion: Opinion | There's A Question About Trump India Hasn't Asked Yet After Venezuela
content: Beyond mere criticism of alliances, Donald Trump has created deep insecurity among partners once reliant on American stability.

title: "Willing To Serve": Machado After Trump Says She "Doesn't Have Respect" In Venezuela
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado on Tuesday said she is "ready and willing to serve" the country, adding that the people of Venezuela have already made their choice.

title: Assam Lawmaker Accuses BJP Of Removing Anti-Party Voters From Special Revision List
content: Raijor Dal president and Independent MLA from Assam's Sivasagar Akhil Gogoi on Tuesday accused the BJP of hatching a conspiracy to remove the names of lakhs of anti-BJP voters from electoral rolls.

title: "Can't Read A Dog's Mind When He Is In A Mood To Bite": Supreme Court
content: Amid the rising dog bite incidents, the Supreme Court, on November 7, last year, ordered the removal of stray dogs from educational institutions, hospitals, bus stands, sports complexes, and railway stations.

title: "Could Endanger NATO': Ex-Danish Envoy To NDTV On Trump's Greenland Push
content: Freddy Svane said the Greenland crisis cannot be separated from what he called a "new world order" driven by raw power.

title: This Trump Aide Was Called A Sell-Out. Venezuela Action Proved Otherwise
content: With the US military's overthrow and snatching of Venezuela's firebrand president Nicolas Maduro, Rubio is savoring victory -- but the outcome came only after compromises that again left many wondering where the old Rubio had gone.

title: Andhra-Based YouTuber Arrested For Producing Child Sexual Abuse Content
content: Kambeti Satya Murthy, a 39-year-old resident of Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, ran a YouTube channel named "Viral Hub" and uploaded videos featuring interviews with minors aged between 15 and 17 years.

title: "You Will Rise": Mahua Moitra Shares Poem For Umar Khalid After Bail Denial
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra on Wednesday shared a short poem in support of jailed activist Umar Khalid after the Supreme Court denied bail to the latter in an alleged larger conspiracy behind the 2020 north-east Delhi riots.

title: Congress Leader Arrested In Rs 28 Crore GST Evasion Case In Hyderabad
content: A Congress leader and transport company executive has been arrested in connection with a GST evasion case involving more than Rs 28 crore, officials from the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) said.

title: "Maza Na Karaya Toh...": Pakistan Army Officer's Unprovoked Threat To India
content: Lieutenant General Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry, the Director General of Pakistan's Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR), once again stirred controversy by linking India with Islamabad's ongoing conflict with Kabul.

title: Opinion: Blog | A Story Not Told in 'Ikkis': What Arun Khetarpal Did With His Rs 685 Army Salary
content: Four months after young Arun wrote a moving letter to his grandfather, he was martyred on December 16, the last day of the 1971 Indo-Pak war.

title: Explained: How Elon Musk's Grok Is Undressing Women, One Prompt At A Time
content: Nonprofit group AI Forensics analysed 20,000 images generated by Grok between December 25 and January 1 and found that 2 per cent depicted a person who appeared to be 18 or younger.

title: Arunachal Orders Demolition Of Illegal Religious Structures After Protests
content: In a major development, Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu on Tuesday directed district authorities to identify and demolish all illegal religious structures in Itanagar.

title: Body Of Woman Murdered In US To Be Flown To India By Jan 8: Minister Kishan Reddy
content: Union Coal Minister G Kishan Reddy on Wednesday said the mortal remains of Nikitha Godishala, who was allegedly killed in the US, are expected to be brought to the country on January 7 or 8.

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Tracking live who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
